sen.j: 賞典禄（しょうてんろく）は、明治維新に功労のあった公卿、大名および士族に対して、政府から家禄の他に賞与として与えられた禄である。
sen.e: Shotenroku was a premium which the government gave as a bonus in addition to a regular salary to court nobles, Japanese feudal lords and members of the warrior class who contributed a great deal to Meiji Restoration.

Shotenroku was a premium which the government gave as a bonus in addition to a hereditary stipend to court nobles, Japanese feudal lords and members of the warrior class who contributed a great deal to Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 「家禄」をhereditary stipendに変更しました。
sen.e: Shotenroku was a premium which the government gave as a bonus in addition to a hereditary stipend to court nobles, Japanese feudal lords and members of the warrior class who contributed a great deal to Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 支給期間によって永世禄、終身禄および年限禄の3種に分類される。
sen.e: It consists of a permanent premium, a lifetime premium and a limited period premium depending on its paying period.
Depending on its benefit period, It is classified into three types including a permanent premium, a lifetime premium and a limited period premium.
Depending on its benefit period, it is classified into three types including a permanent premium, a lifetime premium and a limited period premium.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 戊辰戦争から箱館戦争の間における旧江戸幕府軍及び佐幕派諸藩との戦いは、明治政府の構成員であった公武の人々のみならず、当初は日和見的な態度を取っていた諸藩の助力を得たものであった。
sen.e: At the battles against the former Tokugawa troop and Shogun support domains from the Boshin War to the Battle of Hakodate, the Meiji Government was assisted by not only the Meiji Government's court nobles and samurai but also domains, who were at first fence-sitting.

The battles against the former Tokugawa troop and the supporting domains of the Shogun, from the Boshin War to the Battle of Hakodate, were assisted by not only the court nobles and samurai belonging to the Meiji Government but also domains waiting and seeing how things went at first.
sen.cmt: The battlesを主語にして言い換えました。
sen.e: The battles against the former Tokugawa troop and the supporting domains of the Shogun, from the Boshin War to the Battle of Hakodate, were assisted by not only the court nobles and samurai belonging to the Meiji Government but also domains waiting and seeing how things went at first.

sen.j: このため、戦後も彼らを如何にして新政府につなぎとめるかが課題となり、参戦諸藩や個々の部隊・個人の功労者に対する恩賞が検討された。
sen.e: This made it important to keep them on the Meiji Government side even after the battles, so premiums for the domains, each troop and individual, who contributed to the battles, were considered.
When it became an issue how to anchor them to the new government even after the battles, rewards for the domains, troop and individuals who respectively contributed to the battles were considered.
sen.cmt: 「新政府」「恩賞」の訳を変更し、全体を言い換えました。
sen.e: When it became an issue how to anchor them to the new government even after the battles, rewards for the domains, troop and individuals who respectively contributed to the battles were considered.

sen.j: 新政府内部には、財源の問題から反対論も出されたものの、参戦諸藩の軍事支出に伴う財政悪化が新政府への反感につながることを恐れた結果、恩賞が支給されることとなった。
sen.e: Although there was an objection concerning the financial cost of the premiums inside the new government, the government decided to give them for fear that the domains' financial aggravation caused by military expenses would create ill feeling against the government.

Although due to the financial resources an opposing argument appeared inside the new government, it decided to give rewards for fear that the domains' financial aggravation caused by military expenses in the battles might create ill feeling against it.

Although due to the financial resources an opposing argument appeared inside the new government, it decided to give rewards for fear that the domains' financial aggravation caused by military expenses in the battles might create ill feeling against it.

sen.j: 1869年6月2日、戊辰戦争の軍功者419人と諸隊、諸藩、戦艦に対して禄を授けられた。
sen.e: On June 2, 1869, the government gave the premiums to 419 people who achieved distinguished military service at the Boshin War, troops, domains, and battleships.
On June 2, 1869, the government gave the premiums to 419 people who achieved distinguished military service at the Boshin War, troops, domains, and battleships.
On June 2, 1869, the government gave the premiums to 419 people who achieved distinguished military service at the Boshin War, troops, domains, and battleships.
The total was 745,750 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) of rice and 203,376 ryo (a unit of gold currency) in cash.
The total was 745,750 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) of rice and 203,376 ryo (a unit of gold currency) in cash.
The total was 745,750 koku (a unit of volume: rice 1-koku is 180.39 liter) of rice and 203,376 ryo (a unit of gold currency) in cash.

sen.j: 最高は鹿児島藩主島津忠義・島津久光父子と山口藩主毛利元徳・毛利敬親父子の10万石、高知藩主山内豊範・山内豊信父子の4万石がこれに継ぎ、藩士では西郷隆盛の2000石が最高であった。
sen.e: The highest amount was 100,000 koku given to the lords of Kagoshima Domain: Hisamitsu SHIMAZU and his son, Tadayoshi, and the lords of Yamaguchi Domain: Takachika MORI and his son, Motonori followed by 40,000 koku given to the lords of Kochi Domain: Toyoshige YAMAUCHI and his son, Toyonori, while the highest amount among feudal vassals of domains was 2,000 koku given to Takamori SAIGO.

The highest amount was 100,000 koku given to the lord of Kagoshima Domain Tadayoshi SHIMAZU and his father Hisamitsu SHIMAZU and the lords of Yamaguchi Domain Takachika MORI and his son Motonori MORI, followed by 40,000 koku given to the lords of Kochi Domain Toyoshige YAMAUCHI and his adopted son Toyonori YAMAUCHI, while the highest amount among feudal retainers of domain was 2,000 koku given to Takamori SAIGO.
sen.cmt: 「島津久光」は藩主ではないのでlordは単数に変更しました。「山内豊範」は養父なのでadoptedを用いました。「藩士」はretainerに変更しました。
sen.e: The highest amount was 100,000 koku given to the lord of Kagoshima Domain Tadayoshi SHIMAZU and his father Hisamitsu SHIMAZU and the lords of Yamaguchi Domain Takachika MORI and his son Motonori MORI, followed by 40,000 koku given to the lords of Kochi Domain Toyoshige YAMAUCHI and his adopted son Toyonori YAMAUCHI, while the highest amount among feudal retainers of domain was 2,000 koku given to Takamori SAIGO.

sen.j: 同年9月14日、箱館戦争の軍功者に総額3万5220石及び9名及び艦船9隻に対する3年間の年限禄8万5500石（年あたり28500石）が授けられた。
sen.e: On September 14 of the same year, a total of 35,220 koku was given to those who achieved meritorious services in the Battle of Hakodate and 85,500 koku of limited period premium for three years (28.500 koku per year) was given to nine people and nine battle ships.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On September 14 of the same year, a total of 35,220 koku was given to those who achieved meritorious services in the Battle of Hakodate and 85,500 koku of limited period premium for three years (28,500 koku per year) was given to nine people and nine battle ships.
sen.cmt: コンマを修正しました。
sen.e: On September 14 of the same year, a total of 35,220 koku was given to those who achieved meritorious services in the Battle of Hakodate and 85,500 koku of limited period premium for three years (28,500 koku per year) was given to nine people and nine battle ships.

sen.j: 同月26日には王政復古の功臣を賞して禄を授けられた。
sen.e: On the 26th of the same month, the premium was conferred on meritorious vassals in the Restoration of Imperial Rule.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the 26th of the same month, the premium was conferred on meritorious vassals in the Restoration of Imperial Rule.
On the 26th of the same month, the premium was conferred on meritorious vassals in the Restoration of Imperial Rule.

sen.j: 総額は米3万5150石（うち終身禄8名分7050石）、現金1500両。
sen.e: The total was 35,150 koku of rice (including 7,050 koku of lifetime premiums for eight people) and 1,500 ryo in cash.
The total was 35,150 koku of rice (including 7,050 koku of lifetime premiums for eight people) and 1,500 ryo in cash.
The total was 35,150 koku of rice (including 7,050 koku of lifetime premiums for eight people) and 1,500 ryo in cash.

sen.j: 最高は三条実美と岩倉具視の5000石で、木戸孝允、大久保利通、広沢真臣の1800石がこれに継ぐ。
sen.e: The highest amount was 5,000 koku given to each of Sanetomi SANJO and Tomomi IWAKURA followed by 1,800 koku given to each of Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Saneomi HIROSAWA.
The highest amount was 5,000 koku given to each of Sanetomi SANJO and Tomomi IWAKURA followed by 1,800 koku given to each of Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Saneomi HIROSAWA.
The highest amount was 5,000 koku given to each of Sanetomi SANJO and Tomomi IWAKURA followed by 1,800 koku given to each of Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Saneomi HIROSAWA.

sen.j: 以上の内、注記のないものは何れも永世禄である。
sen.e: All premiums mentioned above without notes are permanent premiums.
All premiums mentioned above without notes are permanent premiums.
All premiums mentioned above without notes are permanent premiums.

sen.j: 原則として、一時金として出された賞典金を除き、1石あたり現米2斗5升が支給された。
sen.e: As a general rule, two to (a unit of volume, approx. 18 litres) five sho (a unit of volume, approx. 1.8 litres) of rice was given per koku except for a premium which was given as a one-time allowance.
As a general rule, 2.5 to (a unit of volume, approx. 18 liters) of rice was given per koku except for premium money which was given as a one-time allowance.
sen.cmt: 「2斗5升」を2.5升に言い換え、litreをliterに変更しました。「賞典金」をpremiun moneyとしました。
sen.e: As a general rule, 2.5 to (a unit of volume, approx. 18 liters) of rice was given per koku except for premium money which was given as a one-time allowance.

sen.j: また、諸藩においても、藩主が授かった賞典禄の中から藩士に恩賞として分与が行われる場合もあった。
sen.e: In some domains, feudal vassals got a part of their lords' premiums as reward grants.
In some domains, feudal retainers got a part of their lords' premiums as reward grants.
In some domains, feudal retainers got a part of their lords' premiums as reward grants.

sen.j: これを分与禄という。
sen.e: t is called a distributed premium.
It is called a distributed premium.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: It is called a distributed premium.

sen.j: 財源は戊辰戦争で敗れた諸藩から没収した所領が充てられた。
sen.e: These premiums were funded through confiscated territories of domains that were defeated in the Boshin War.
These premiums were funded through confiscated territories of domains that were defeated in the Boshin War.
These premiums were funded through confiscated territories of domains that were defeated in the Boshin War.

sen.j: だが、家禄とともに財政悪化の一因となった。
sen.e: Premiums together with hereditary stipends brought about financial aggravation.
Premiums together with hereditary stipends brought about financial aggravation.
Premiums together with hereditary stipends brought about financial aggravation.

sen.j: 支給総額は、永世録80万9070石、終身録7050石、年限録8万5500石で、計90万1620石に上る。
sen.e: The total amount of premiums was 901,620 koku which was consisted of 809,070 koku for permanent premiums; 7,050 koku for life time premiums; and 85,500 for limited period premiums.
The total amount of premiums was 901,620 koku which was consisted of 809,070 koku for permanent premiums, 7,050 koku for life time premiums, and 85,500 for limited period premiums.
sen.cmt: コンマに変更しました。
sen.e: The total amount of premiums was 901,620 koku which was consisted of 809,070 koku for permanent premiums, 7,050 koku for life time premiums, and 85,500 for limited period premiums.

sen.j: 1876年、金禄公債の支給とともに廃された。
sen.e: In 1876, government bonds of monetary salary caused the premium to be abolished.
In 1876, government bonds of monetary salary caused the premium to be abolished.
In 1876, government bonds of monetary salary caused the premium to be abolished.
